Bien expérimenté dans ce domaine, joseph a une clientèle sans cesse grandissante et exigeante. Ne disposant pas d'assez de matières premières pour fabriquer des marmites en grande quantité, il souhaite avec l'argent du crédit acheter une grande quantité d'aluminium afin de fabriquer assez de marmites pour satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices tirés de cette augmentation seront réinjectés dans l'activité et permettront à Joseph de garantir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Joseph is a young 38-year old Cameroonian.  He is married and father of five children, of which the youngest is 4-years old and the oldest is 16-years old.  Four attend school.  In order to take care of his family's needs, Joseph has been making cooking pots that he sells in a neighborhood of the city for almost 16 years.  Very experienced in this domain, Joseph has an ever-growing and demanding clientele. Without enough raw materials to make large quantities of pots, Joseph would like to use the loan to buy a large quantity of aluminum in order to make enough pots to satisfy his customers.  The profits from this increase will be reinvested in his business and will allow Joseph to ensure a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy aluminum.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 36 years old, married and a father of two children. He sells automobile spare parts in Mpeketoni, Lamu for a living where he earns a monthly income of about KES 14, 000.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer. He has applied for a loan of KES 60, 000 to purchase the additional stock of spare parts he needs.
Stephen intends to continue growing his business and hopes that one day he will own a well-established automobile garage.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Bunthol

texts.en:
An elderly mother of five children, Bunthol is 57 years old and married. To support their living, she does rice growing on an area of two hectares and runs a small rice milling service in the local area in Kampong Cham province. She has been engaged in the current business for 15 years, earning almost 5USD per day. 

Bunthol has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles including this loan. The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, improved her lifestyle gradually. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan to buy rice seed, potash, and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes to gain a high yield, better than last year, to better off her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, potash, and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and lives together with her husband in the village of Kwale, Mombasa. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.
For over two years, she has sold Khanga’s, an African women’s wrap, selling at the market. She says that her challenge is the high cost of purchasing her products. Fatuma dreams of expanding into a wholesale business to earn more income.
With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Richel

texts.en:
Ma. Richel is 29 years old and married with one child.
She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Richel is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm needs.
Ma. Richel has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling jewelry.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm needs for her sugarcane crop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a small scale baker who bakes bread to sell in Mpohor, near Takoradi. She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. Elizabeth has been working as a baker for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread, thus allowing her to meet the rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a 41-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 6 children; the youngest child is 5 months old while the oldest is 21. She engages in farming by growing rice. She has been growing rice for 12 years. With a lack of capital to finance her farm, Rowena requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings to improve the harvest. Rowena would like to invest in her business to support her family and also to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings.

loans.name: Patterson

texts.en:
Patterson is 65 years old, married and a father of six children. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. Patterson was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000, to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business.
Patterson will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay the school fees of his youngest children as well as expand his farming activities.
His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business.

loans.name: Precel

texts.en:
Precel is 38 years old and married with three children.
She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Precel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vitamins and feeds for her pigs.
Precel has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vitamins and feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with two school going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rental bills.
For over eight years, she has operated a retail shop, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in her business.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and washing detergents. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking fat oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Seferian

texts.es:
Seferina es una mujer de 46 años de edad luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completo y madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y el último estudia en el kínder. Con ella vive su madre una mujer adulta la cual es un ejemplo para ella y para sus hijos por ser una mujer luchadora y con muchas fuerzas, ella colabora con algunas actividades en el hogar. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy joven actividad que ella disfruta hacer ya que desde muy pequeña le gusto y agrado la experiencia. Este es el único medio de ingreso para su familia en la actualidad por medio del cual se ha superado y ha podido salir adelante. La propiedad que ella trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 10 metros de su casa de habitación y que en compañía de su hermana trabajan dando mantenimiento a sus cultivos como: abono, limpieza, etc. Su producto es comercializado a través de intermediarios que llegan a la zona, vecinos y ellos mismos que viajan hasta la zona de comercio para su venta.

Actualmente Seferina solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de papa ya que de esta forma ella mantendrá sano y salvo de plagas y bichos sus cultivos.

Sus planes son de poder ampliar y sembrar una variedad de productos para sus consumidores ya que de esta forma ella podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos y formarlos con principios y con valores apoyándolos en sus estudios y demás metas que ellos se propongan cumplir y realizar.
texts.en:
Seferina is a 46-year-old woman and a hard worker.  She completed elementary school and is the single mother of three children, two of whom are currently in different grades in elementary school.  Her youngest is in kindergarten.  Seferina lives with her mother; an elderly woman who is an example to both her and her children as she is a real fighter and has a lot of strength.  She helps out with some of the tasks around the house.

Seferina's parents taught her to work the land when she was very young.  She enjoys her work and has done so since she was very young.  She enjoyed the learning experience.  This is the only source of income for Seferina's family right now and it has enabled her to improve herself and get ahead in life.  Seferina owns the land that she works, having received it as an inheritance from her parents.  It is located 10 meters from her home and both she and her sister work it, maintaining the crops by fertilizing, weeding, etc.  Seferina's produce is sold through middlemen who visit the area and to their neighbors.  The sisters themselves also travel to a commercial area to sell their produce. 

Seferina is currently requesting help to buy manure and fertilizers for her potato crops as this is how she will keep them healthy and safe from pests and bugs.  Her plans are to expand her business and grow a variety of produce for her customers.  She would like to be able to offer her customers a wider variety of produce.  Seferina's dream is to see her children grow up and to raise them with principles and values.  She will support them in their studies and with any other goals they set themselves.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for her potato crops

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en: Korkor is divorced and has 6 children. She is now an established businesswoman, who operates a chop bar (a place where a variety of African dishes are sold) in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 6 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Korkor uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients needed to prepare her food, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Korkor plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to prepare her food.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Ruth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling biscuits, candies and soft drinks in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Ruth is single with 2 children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her provide for her family. Ruth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of biscuits, candies and soft drinks. In the long term, Ruth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of biscuits, candies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells beauty products directly to her customers. She lives in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to increase her inventory of beauty products for her direct selling business.

Remedios has been in this business for 8 years. She earns extra income from food vending and raising pigs.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of beauty products.

loans.name: Amelia Estela

texts.es:
Amelia, se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que posee  un comedor donde hay diversidad de menú para los clientes, este lo realiza solo con la ayuda de su compañero de vida y lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm asimismo se dedica a vender ropa.  Amelia, no tiene hijos y no recibe ayuda del extranjero. 
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en la comprar carnes, arroz, lechuga, entre otros y asimismo adquirir  blusas, pantalones, camisas, entre otros para así brindarles variedad de mercadería a sus clientes; este le ayudara a aumentar sus ventas y con ello obtener mayores ganancias. 
Su objetivo es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Amelia makes a living from selling food, as she has a restaurant with a diverse menu for clients. She does this with just the help of her life partner and carries out her business from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. She also makes a living from selling clothing. Amelia does not have children and doesn't receive help from abroad.

She will invest the loan she needs in buying meat, rice and lettuce, among other things, and also acquiring blouses, pants and shirts, among other things, in order to provide her clients with a variety of merchandise. This will help her to increase her sales and with them to obtain better earnings. Her objective is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and lettuce, among other things, and also to acquire blouses, pants and shirts, among other things.

loans.name: Andrés De Jesús

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona muy trabajadora, realiza varios oficios; entre estos están agricultor, jornalero y albañil, estos trabajos los aprendió gracias a su padre y un amigo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla de maíz, limpieza del terreno y rastreo del suelo, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados. Él disfruta mucho trabajar en el campo, y este crédito le ayudara a continuar trabajando en lo que más le gusta y además obtendrá el maíz para consumo de su familia y para la venta.
texts.en:
Andrés is 49 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a very hard-working person who carries out a number of business activities.  He works as a farmer, day laborer and builder.  He learned these trades from his father and a friend.

Andrés is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy corn seed, and to have his 7,000 sq. meters of land weeded and broken up prior to planting.  Andrés really enjoys working the land and this loan will help him to continue doing what he loves best.  He will grow corn for his family's own consumption and will sell the surplus.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, and to have his land to be weeded and broken up so that he can sow crops over 7,000 sq. meters

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kábata Group

texts.es:
Brileyda es una de las socias de Banco Mujer Kábata, un grupo de mujeres indígenas. Ella es una mujer joven, de 26 de edad, y madre de 2 hijos, uno de 11 años y otro de 9, estudiantes de primaria. Vive en unión libre con el padre de sus hijos, ambos son agricultores y trabajan en una pequeña finca propia, cultivando plátano. Este es su segundo crédito, y el anterior fue de gran ayuda ya que le permitió comprar insumos como semillas, abonos, insecticidas y otros para trabajar con más facilidad, aumentar la producción y mejorar la calidad del producto. 
Al igual que el anterior este crédito se va a invertir en insumos para la siembra del plátano. Su meta es incrementar los ingresos por medio de su actividad para mejorar la calidad de vida, y el entorno en el que vive ella y su familia. 
Junto a Brileyda hay 3 socias más que van a invertir en actividades de agricultura y comercio.
texts.en:
Brileyda is one of the female partners of Banco Mujer Kábata, a group of indigenous women. She is a young woman, 26 years old, and the mother of two children, one 11 years old and the other 9, both students in primary school. She is in a civil union with the father of her children. They are both farmers and work on a small farm they own, cultivating plantains. 

This is her second loan, and the previous one was a great help as it allowed her to buy supplies like seeds, fertilizer, insecticides and other things to be able to work with more ease, to increase production, and to improve the quality of the product. Like the previous, this loan will be invested in supplies for planting plantains. Her goal is to increase her income by means of her business in order to improve her quality of life and the environment in which she and her family live.
 
Along with Brileyda, there are 3 other female partners who are going to invest in agricultural and commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, plastic bags and other supplies for planting

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Rady, a 20-year-old married man blessed with two little kids, is local farmer from Takeo Province’s Samrong district. He strives for a living by farming rice on one hectare; this is his primary source of income. He is able to earn extra income through working as a sales agent promoting a water filter product. 

Rady wants to obtain a bachelor's degree specializing in Marketing. Hence, he is seeking his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to pay his school tuition fees. He hopes that he can have a bright future through getting an academic degree and obtain a good job to sustain him and especially his kids.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Yancis Carolina

texts.es:
Yancis, se dedica a la venta de marisco, ya que inicia su negocio como una fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia, este lo lleva a cabo de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. Ella está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, uno de seis meses y el otro de 8 años de edad, no recibe ayuda del extranjero.
El préstamo  que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de cangrejos, pescado, conchas, entre otros productos y luego venderlo a los clientes; este le ayudara a mejorar sus inventarios e incrementar la clientela.
Su objetivo es optimizar el negocio y aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Yancis' business is selling seafood.  She started her business as she needed a source of income with which to support her family.  She works from 6.00am to 4.00pm.  Yancis lives with her partner and her two children: ages 6 months and 8 years.  She does not receive any help from abroad.

Yancis needs this loan to invest in buying crabs, fish, shellfish and other products which she will sell to her customers.  This will help her to improve her stock and increase her number of customers.

Yancis' goal is to optimize her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy crabs, fish, shellfish, etc.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es: Anderson, de 27 años de edad , esta casado y tiene 3 pequeños hijos con los cuales vive en su casa propia.Anderson tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos el trabajo de la compra y venta de productos regionales ya sean plátanos, yucas, limones, naranjas u otras frutas, pescados secos, maíz, arroz, frijoles y todo lo que considere comercial. Desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de adquirir los mejores productos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 1año y le esta yendo muy bien. Por las noches trabaja en la ejecución de algunas obras de infraestructura como operador técnico de maquinaria pesada.Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando su labor aprendió muchas cosas ya que las experiencias que ha tenido le enseñaron a ser mas cuidadoso con algunos productos y a poder invertir más en otros que tienen mayor demanda en determinados periodos. Espera seguir trabajando mucho ya que su máximo anhelo es poder brindarles a sus pequeños una educación de calidad, además desea poner una bodega donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad todos los productos que ofrece a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas seguro de avanzar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado comprará periódicamente plátanos, yucas y cítricos para que siga trabajando.
texts.en:
27-year-old Anderson is married and has three young children.  They live together in their own home.  Anderson's source of income is buying and selling regional products such as bananas, cassava, lemons, oranges, other fruit, dried fish, corn, rice, beans and everything he believes he can sell.  He gets up very early in the morning and heads to the city's main port in search of the best products to buy.  He has been in this line of work for one year and he is doing very well.  In the evenings, Anderson works on some infrastructure building work as a heavy machinery operator.  During the time he has spent in his work, he has learned many things.  The experiences he has had have taught him to be more careful with some products and to invest more in others which have a higher demand at certain times of year.  He hopes to continue working hard as his biggest goal is to provide his little ones with a good-quality education.  He would also like to set up a grocery store where he can sell his products to his customers in a more relaxed fashion.  

On this occasion, Anderson is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles.  He is grateful to everybody who makes it possible for him to access this loan as it will make him feel more secure in making progress in his work.  He will use the sum of money he has requested to periodically buy bananas, cassava and citrus fruit so that he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassava and citrus fruit

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 22-year-old single woman who has been selling beauty cosmetics and perfumes for the last three years. In 2012, Fatima started her own business because she wanted to earn a better living. She has a good number of customers, most of whom are neighbors, relatives and friends. They  recommend her to others and help her increase her income.

Fatima is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise inventory by buying a special spring and summer collection of cosmetics.

Fatima hopes to open her own shop in the future; however, at the present time, she can't afford the expense.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise inventory by buying a special spring and summer collection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and married with three children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from providing e-loading (mobile prepaid loading) services.

In the future, Victoria aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en:
Narciso is 61 years old and married with five children. To earn a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been in the farming business for nearly 10 years and earns about PHP 20,000 twice a year (during the harvest). He also pays additional laborers to help him in planting and harvesting rice. Narciso has been very patient in maintaining good crop growth.  Now, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 40,000 to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) used in farming. 

In the future, Narciso would like to develop good crops to harvest. This will enable him to better his family's living conditions and someday live progressively.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) used in farming.

loans.name: Kendalls

texts.es: Kendalls, de 39 años de edad ,esta casada con Héctor y tiene 3 hijos .El trabajo de Kendalls consiste en el alquiler de mototaxis ya que tiene 2 mototaxis los cuales alquila como vehículos de servicio de transporte público por las principales calles de la ciudad. Lleva en ésta actividad un poco más de 1 año y gracias a eso sus ingresos han mejorado y  ha podido solucionar algunas carencias que antes había en su hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo como dueña de los mototaxis es que le permite tener tiempo libre para realizar otras funciones, lo más difícil para ella es tener que madrugar para cumplir con los horarios de salida, sabe que el trabajo es arduo pero comprende que los mejores frutos de su esfuerzo vendran más adelante , ahora espera comprar otro vehículo y seguir en el camino del progreso.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual..Con el monto solicitado comprará respuestos para sus vehículos y los mandarña al de mecánica para su revisión semestral.
texts.en:
Kendalls is 39 years old, married to Héctor and has three children. Kendalls' work consists of renting out mototaxis, as she has 2 mototaxis that she rents out as service vehicles for public transport on the main streets of the city. She has had this business for a little more than a year; her earnings have improved and she has been able to resolve some things that her home needed thanks to this business. 

What she likes the most about her work as a mototaxi owner is that it allows her to have free time to do other things. The hardest part for her is having to get up early to comply with the hours of departure. She knows that the work is arduous but she understands that the best fruits of her efforts will come down the road. Now she hopes to buy another vehicle and continue on the path of progress.  

At this time she will request 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles. She is very content to know that she has financial support, as she will feel more secure going forward with her work this way. She also commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. With the amount requested she will buy replacement parts for her vehicles and she will send the vehicles to the mechanic for their semiannual checkup.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her vehicles

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 50 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona que trabaja en la agricultura desde hace 32 años, año con año él realiza sus cultivos; esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, ya que desde los 12 años de edad lo acompañaba al campo y fue así como ha venido trabajando en la agricultura y como jornal. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres sacos de abono y herbicidas para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados. La inversión le permitirá continuar con sus cultivos para que obtenga una buena cosecha que le ayude a mejorar su vivienda para brindarle protección a su familia y ver a sus hijos triunfar.
texts.en:
Carlos is 50 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has three children. He is a person who has worked in agriculture for 32 years, raising his crops year after year. He learned this profession from his father, since from the age of 12 he accompanied him to the fields, and he has continued working as a farmer and as a day laborer. 

The loan he is requesting from the Campo Foundation is to buy three sacks of fertilizer and herbicides to plant 10,500 square meters. This investment will allow him to continue with his crops so that he obtains a good harvest. This will help him improve his home, to provide protection to his family and see his children get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer and herbicides to plant 10,500 square meters.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman who is blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Judith has operated a green grocery business, selling retail products to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Judith dreams of expanding her business and earning more profits so that she may educate her children in the future.

With the loan of KES 50,000, Judith will purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, bananas, green vegetables and onions for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, bananas, green vegetables and onions for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo,  se dedica a la agricultura como un medio para obtener ingresos y asimismo ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, este lo realiza desde las 4:00 am a 12:00 pm, lo aprendió con su padre desde que estaba pequeño.  Ricardo, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 8, 12, 14 y 16 años; no posee ayuda del extranjero. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla para la siembra de frijol y maíz. Este le ayudara a mejorar su producción y con ello aumentar las ventas para generar ingresos para el hogar. 
Su objetivo es mejor su vivienda y brindarle una  calidad de vida favorable  a su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo works in agriculture as a means of earning an income and also to help his family with household expenses. He does this from 4:00 am to 12:00 pm, having learned it from his father from the time he was young.  Ricardo has a partner and four children, ages 8, 12, 14 and 16. He doesn't have any help from abroad.

He will invest the loan he needs in buying fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and seeds for planting beans and corn. This will help him to improve his production and thus increase sales to generate income for his home.

His objective is to improve his home and to provide a favorable quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and seeds for planting beans and corn

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She started with only one piglet that she raised as a sow for breeding. Every time her sow gives birth, she separates five heads to raise for fattening and sale when in times of financial crisis. Jovelyn has been seven years in this business.

Jovelyn wishes for a loan of PHP 31,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes to prosper with the business she has now and be able to give a comfortable living to her three children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Ma. Darlie

texts.en:
Ma. Darlie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Ma. Darlie is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Darlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has five children. Her husband works as a transport inspector.

Although she has received no formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling beans, yams and cassava near Cape Coast. She has been involved in this enterprise for seven years. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of beans, yams and cassava. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to buy beans, yams and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, a single man, is striving to secure his future and help his relatives financially as much as possible. He has been raising hogs for five years, a business he loves since it is his sole source of income.

Wilson wants to build a piggery house, but due to insufficient capital is requesting a loan of P31,000 to buy hollow blocks and cement with which to build it. He hopes to raise more pigs in the future.

loans.use: to buy hollow blocks and cement to build his piggery house.

loans.name: Joiakim

texts.en:
Joiakim is a farmer and tricycle driver from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Joiakim is a married man and he has a 2-year-old daughter.

Joiakim is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and eventually its harvest. 

In the future, Joiakim hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Loline

texts.en:
Loline is 30 years old and a mother of one child. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling medicine at her pharmacy store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

Loline was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 to buy additional medicines stock for her pharmacy to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional medicines stock for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married mother of five, received schooling to the end of middle school. Her husband is a driver, while Agnes has been selling clothing in Mpohor (near Takoradi) for about three years. Her income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Agnes will use this loan to increase her existing clothing capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing clothing capacity

loans.name: Ma. Milva

texts.en:
Ma. Milva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and earns more income from farming rice and food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to customers. Ma. Milva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 25-year-old single woman who started working in the art business 11 years ago. She started her own business with the help of her parents very early, to help her explore her talents and improve them, without neglecting her education. These are the reasons she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua today.

Sally draws and paints on glass and she also makes special events souvenirs. She is very talented in her business and all of her customers are happy dealing with her.

Sally is improving and increasing her business production a lot. With the applied for loan, she will pay for her university fees and for special, newly released drawing tools and glass items necessary for developing her business.

She is looking forward to opening her own shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy colors and glass necessary for her business in addition to paying her university educational fees.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
After completing primary school, Georgina  decided to set up her own doughnut business in Mpohor (near ATakoradi). With some years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her purchase more flour and sugar to prepare her doughnuts for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar to prepare her doughnuts for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Sonia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling firewood.  

Sonia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Geogina

texts.en: After graduating from middle school, Georgina decided to set up her own provision business in Mpohor (near  Takoradi). With over 10 years’ of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. This loan will be used to help her buy more provisions for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a miner) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to buy more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is married and lives with 5 dependents, two for whom he took over guardianship after the demise of their parents. He started as a small farmer and cattle keeper, but later, after attending several trainings from NAADs, he realized that relying on subsistence farming would not allow him to achieve his goal. 

He sold his local breed cattle and bought hybrid cows that yield more milk and at the same time can be kept on a small piece of land. With the help of NAADs he has received free coffee seedlings and now wants to buy manure. 

However, his capital is not enough to invest in a coffee plantation and at the same time support his cattle business. Therefore, he applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from UGAFODE to help him buy organic manure to improve the coffee yields.

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 4 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is coming to Yehu for another Kiva loan, of KES 50,000, to expand her charcoal-selling business. With the loan, she wants to buy 140 sacks of charcoal for resale. Her previous loan had a great impact, and she was able to increase her monthly profits. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the near future. She is grateful for Yehu Microfinance and Kiva lenders for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy 140 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is married, and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Catalina has been in this business for 30 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Catalina successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Catalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet resides in Nkubu, is married and has three children. She has been farming for over thirty years, producing cereals. She has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy irrigation equipment. This will provide a good supply of water from the source to the farm. She says it will improve their standard of living. The challenges she faces are: crop pests and diseases, and insufficient rain. She is happy with Juhudi for funding her.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro is a farmer from Solana. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. Pedro has been managing a farming business for over 10 years. He plants and harvests rice to sell and earns about PHP 20,000 from each harvest. He uses it to pay laborers, for capital in the business, and to pay education fees. He is now applying for a loan of PHP 40,000 to pay labor costs for planting and transplanting rice to sell and to buy fertilizer for maintenance. Pedro will be very happy to achieve a plentiful harvest some day. He will use the income to keep improving his farming business and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for planting and transplanting rice to sell, and to buy fertilizer for maintenance.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 47 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a con esposo y sus 2 hijos.La actividad de Judith consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas y cervezas bien heladas y lo complementa con chupetes y hielo ,constantemente recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora ,quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su capital, luego sencillamente coloca las botellas en su congelador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes que acuden a ella en busca de obtener la bebida más refrescante para calmar la sed que les produce el intenso calor que caracteriza a su ciudad. Trabaja sola desde hace 10 años y comparte esta función con otro trabajo privado. Está muy contenta con su trabajo porque puede estar en contacto constante con sus amigos, vecinos y algunos clientes con lo que ha formado una buena relación de negocio.Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por ello que más adelante desea establecer una distribuidora de bebidas para ofrecer bebidas gasificadas y cervezas al por mayor.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos .Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente mayor cantidad de cajas de bebidas gasificadas y cervezas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and their 2 children. Judith's business consists of selling soft drinks and beers that are very cold, and she complements this with ice pops and ice. She is constantly receiving the representative of the distribution company in her home; the representative is in charge of noting her request so that they send her the requested amount the following day in accordance with her capital. She then simply places the bottles in her freezer and waits for the eventual arrival of her clients, who come to her in search of the most refreshing beverage to quench the thirst produced by the intense heat that is characteristic of their city. She has worked on her own for the last 10 years and also has another private job.

She is very content with her work because she can be in constant contact with her friends, neighbors, and some clients she has formed a good business relationship with. While it is certain that her business produces good financial earnings for her, she feels that it's still too little to cover her primary household expenses, and so she wants to establish a beverage distribution company down the road to offer soft drinks and beer wholesale.

At this time she will request 600 Peruvian nuevos soles, for which she thanks all of the people who make her loan to continue with her objectives possible. With the requested amount she will progressively buy a greater quantity of boxes of soft drinks and beers in order to keep working.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with five children. She received some schooling, up till the end of middle-school level. Currently, Gladys sells cooking utensils in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about 10 years now. Her husband is in another occupation. Gladys' income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Gladys will use the loan to increase her existing stock of cooking utensils. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Gladys plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing stock of cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land for sand mining.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia works hard to support her family. Rosalia is married and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Rosalia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalia has been in this business for 26 years now, and also earns additional income from a pig-fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food production and pig-fattening businesses.

In the future, Rosalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase stocks of ingredients for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Dede is a small scale baker who bakes bread to sell in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has had some formal education and she is a Junior High School graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver.  Elizabeth has been working as a baker for close to 15 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, which would help her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope lives in Tiribe, Kenya. She is married and a mother of one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Hope has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality in her products. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 56-year-old who owns and manages a small furniture making business in her community. With 5 years in this business, she is able to support the studies of her three children. She continues her business to provide a better living for her family. 

In fact, she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy more different woods to produce higher quality tables, chairs and doors. These goods will be a big help in acquiring a higher income each month. She wants to continue increasing her profit in order to achieve success in her business. This will help to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more different woods.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 26 years old. For the last three years, he has earned a living by selling goods at his general store in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of 17,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of 35,000 KES to buy additional stock for his shop such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks and maize flour to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his nephew as well as expand his business. His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a small scale food vendor in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school level graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a driver. 

Mary has been working as a food vendor for close to 10 years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of foodstuffs and other ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of foodstuffs and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns more income from selling kitchenware and raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: After graduating with a diploma, Gifty decided to set up her own provision business in Mpohor (near Takoradi). With over three years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more provisions for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a miner) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a small-scale baker who bakes bread for sale in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver.  

Dorcas has been working as a baker for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 41 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from his food kiosk in Malindi. He earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from the business. 

Festus was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions for sale to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as continue expanding the business. His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 29 años de edad , es madre soltera y enfrenta el mundo con valor y fuerza por el bienestar de su único hijo de 10 años, ella vive en casa de su madre junto a su hermana y su menor hijo.El trabajo de Edith consiste en la venta al por menor de productos de primera necesidad, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva trabajando por 11 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su madre pero ahora el negocio es solo de ella y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hermana cuando ella tiene que cumplir otras funciones fuera de casa.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única bodega en su localidad, espera poder seguir surgiendo y hacer crecer su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2800, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería para su venta en su bodega conformada por golosinas, arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites, gaseosas, embutidos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Edith, age 29, is a single mother.  She faces the world with courage and strength for the well-being of her only child, age 10.  She lives in her mother’s house together with her sister and her minor child.

Edith’s work is selling basic needs products for retail prices.  Among the items she sells are rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables, and more.  She has this business in her house, and she tends to it full-time every day.  She has been working in this trade for 11 years.

In the beginning she had help from her mother, but now she is alone in the business.  Sometimes she gets help from her sister when she has to accomplish other tasks outside of the home.  What she likes about her work is that she has time to complete other everyday activities.  

Fortunately, it is going very well for her because she always has customers.  This is due to the variety of products that she offers and because it is the only grocery store in her area.  She hopes to be able to continue emerging and to make her business grow.

She will now request 2,800 soles.  She is very grateful for the loan opportunity given to her and for the financial backing she needs to get ahead.  She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise to sell in her store.  She will buy candy, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, cooking oil, soft drinks, sausages, vegetables, and others.

loans.use: to buy candy, rice, sugar, bread, and others.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is 42 years old and is married with 5 children. The family survives solely on coffee farming and cattle raising. Boaz has become innovative, and from his small savings he has started a petrol selling business to provide for the off season. He has diversified into cattle fattening to increase his supply of organic manure to put onto his coffee plantation. 

Now, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers for putting on his plantation during this rainy season in anticipation of higher yields next season. He is excited about the partnership with Kiva through UGAFODE Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is a married man and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. Lazaro dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase retail shop items like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Lazaro joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop items like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 26 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a boutique for two years with an income of about 18,000 KES a month. 

Julie is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of clothes to sell.  She hopes to be able to meet her basic financial needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine  is married. She received some schooling, till the end of  Junior high school. Currently,  Josephine  sells movies, discs, tapes, DVDs, pen drives, etc. in Mpohor  (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this business for about  three years now. Her husband is a tailor.  

Josephine's  income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.   She will use the loan to expand her existing inventory of movies, discs, tapes etc.. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise,   Josephine plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to expand her existing inventory of movies, discs, tapes, DVD, pen drives, etc.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El sr. Héctor, es casado su esposa es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos y toda su familia dependen de él ya que solamente él trabaja y asegura la manutención del hogar como los gastos del colegio de los niños con su trabajo como operario de limpieza desde hace muchos años. Solicita el crédito para la construcción de un anexo el cual destinara para sala ya que actualmente  ocupa una sola área para sala y cocina lo que es una situación muy incómoda para él y su familia, así como también construirá una pared ya que está pegado del muro de otra casa vecina y necesita independizarse.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife and the family depends on his support, since he is the only one that has a paid job. He pays for the home expenses and the children’s education, and has been working as a cleaner for many years. 

Héctor is requesting a loan to build an additional room, which will become his living room. The kitchen and the living room are today located in the same room, which is uncomfortable for him and his family. He will also build a wall to separate his house from the neighbors’, since they share a wall. This will improve his privacy.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint(menuisier en aluminium) dans les charges du foyer, Adjowa a débuté en 2012 par vendre des produits congelés. Manquant de fonds pour  acheter ses marchandises, elle sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt. Cet argent lui permettra d'acheter des produits congelés. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, elle espère acheter un autre réfrigérateur et assurer les besoins de la famille. Notons qu’elle est maman de deux adorables enfants scolarisés âgés de 07 et 05ans.
texts.en:
To help out her husband (an aluminum furniture maker) to cover household expenses, Adjowa started off by selling frozen products in 2012. Lacking the funds to purchase her merchandise, she is requesting financial aid from WAGES with an initial loan. This money will enable her to purchase frozen products. 

For the future, she hopes to purchase another refrigerator and to ensure that her family's needs are met. Let us note that she is a mom with two adorable children in school who are 7 and 5 years old.

loans.use: to purchase frozen products to sell

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
One of two breadwinners in a family with two children who are still in school, Savorn is a rural farmer from Battambang province. To cover their daily cost of living, she has managed to have a small vegetable garden, growing cabbages and peas as the main source of income while her husband works for others for a fee for extra income, besides helping her on the farmland. The current business has returned her a decent income to support her living, 26,400 KHR per day. 

Savorn is a seventh-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely which has enabled her to stablize her living conditions in a proper standard of living. Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. The total requested loan amount of her group is 3,600,000 KHR. Savorn, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income so she can buy an additional plot of farmland to make her business larger.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Analiza is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  is a widow and lives together with her seven dependents.  Abena sells foodstuffs like plantains and coco-yams  in Jukwa near Abura which she has done for 30 years. As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  She will use her loan to purchase more plantains to sell. With the new profit, Abena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle, 44 years of age, is separated from her husband and now she's taking care of her six children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years. In her business her net income is 100 PHP daily, and she would like to access an income amounting to 11,000 PHP to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will improve.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of seven grown children. 

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farm and its harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua has a small business; she sells ladies and men's clothing, which she has done for three years.  She is married to a mason, and has two children. 

Efua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more ladies and men's clothing to sell.

The profit from her expanded business will help Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies and men's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 66 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angeles is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angeles has been raising pigs for 12 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Urania Lisseth

texts.es:
Urania tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es costurera desde los 14 años de edad, gracia a que sus padres la apoyaron para que aprendiera este oficio y también conoce el oficio de estilismo. Actualmente esta costurando los uniformes de los estudiantes de escuelas publicas en el país. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una tela que le sirve para los uniformes escolares. Así, ella terminara de elaborar los uniformes y empleara a más personas para que le ayuden. Su idea es establecer su propio taller para crecer y aumentar el número de clientes.
texts.en:
Urania is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She has been a seamstress since she was 14, thanks to the fact that her parents helped her to learn this trade, and she also knows hairdressing. Currently she is selling student uniforms used in the country's public schools.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay for fabric that she will use to make school uniforms. This way she will complete the uniforms and employ more people to help her. Her idea is to set up her own workshop, so that she can grow and increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric that she will use to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de ganado y especies menores, desde la edad de los 20 años de edad; lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde pequeña le enseñaron diferentes oficios para ganarse la vida. Posee tres vacas lecheras las que le sirven para alimentar a sus hijos. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe de caminar durante veinte minutos para llegar a la carretera y después aborda dos microbuses hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, herbicidas y foliares para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz para alimentar a su familia. Con las ganancias espera reparar su vivienda antes que inicie la época lluviosa y afecte a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She makes a living through agriculture; raising cattle and small animals, and has done so since she was 20 years old.  She learned it from her parents because at a young age they taught her different jobs in order to earn a living.  

She has three dairy cows that help to feed her children.  In order to buy farming supplies she has to walk 20 minutes to get to the road and then boards a minibus to get to the city.  The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy manure, herbicides, and leaf fertilizer to plant her 7,000 square meters of corn to feed her family.  With the earnings she hopes to repair her home before the rainy season begins and affects her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and leaf fertilizers to plant her 7,000 square meters of corn to feed her family.

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.fr: Père d’un enfant de 05ans, mr Kouassi mariée est revendeur et en même temps peintre bâtiment. Il revend des sacs de charbons de bois qu’il achète à Lomé et dans les villes de l’intérieur du pays. Démarré en 2008 cette activité, il s'y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité de vente de charbons de bois. Il espère agrandir son secteur d’activité et assurer au mieux au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: The father of a 5-year-old child, Mr. Kouassi is a retailer and a building painter at the same time. He sells sacks of charcoal which he purchases in Lomé and from inland cities. Starting this business in 2008, he is very pleased, since it brings in the revenues enabling him to support himself. He is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to bolster his business selling charcoal. He hopes to expand his business sector and to ensure his family's needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Layidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq femmes du groupe Layidou sont toutes mariées  dans les familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni dans la commune rurale de Sakoiba dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce du lait de vache de toutes sortes (lait frais, caillé et du yaourt) et des grains (haricot, mil et riz). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Dado (femme assise devant avec le bidon bleu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de lait de toutes sortes dans le village de Ouolobougouni;  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 250 litres de lait avec les éleveurs du village. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Dado espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Layidou are all married in polygamous families. The women average 35 years of age and four children each all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Commune Rurale de Sakoiba (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving cow's milk of all kinds (fresh milk, curdled, yogurt) and grains (beans, millet, and rice). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Dado (the woman seated in front with a blue container in the photo) is a major vendor of milk of all sorts in the village of Ouolobougouni; she intends to use her loan to purchase 250 liters of milk from the livestock farmers in the village. The sales are made, cash or credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Dado hopes to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children's care.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cow's milk

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edicto owns a grocery store. He is a member of the El Gran Esfuerzo ("the great effort") 1, 2 & 3 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. This group is dedicated mostly to people in the door-to-door business, vending their products on foot in different communities.

Edicto is the hard-working father of six children. He lives with his wife and two of their children; the others are living in their own homes, and some reside in Haiti. He tells us that his biggest challenge is to finish building the family house, and he is still saving his business profits toward this goal. With this loan, he will invest in his business by purchasing products for daily meals to sell like rice, flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, some other grocery products; these kinds of businesses are called 'Colmado'.

Edicto is very excited to receive his 13th loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He has had this business for about eight years. He started the business using the first loan he received from us. His dream is to finish construction on his house and to live quietly in it with his family.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and some other grocery products.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is one of the members of the Grupo Mujeres Progresando 1, 2, & 3, made up of 15 micro-business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Elizabeth is very excited to be receiving her 8th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth. She has had her business selling shoes for around four years. She started the business with her own resources. 

Elizabeth is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different shoe brands and styles for women, men and kids. She is going to use her earnings to continue to reinvest in her business and provide for her family's needs. With her previous loans, she started increasing her sales and savings. 

She is dreaming of having an improved business and of living tranquilly in a safe home with her family. She tells us that her most difficult challenge was to establish her business. She loves to watch television and to be at home with her children. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and begin her home's construction

loans.name: Mentor

texts.en:
Mentor, 36, has been working construction for a very long time; he earns a very low salary. He is married, father of two children, and his wife is a house wife.

In order to cut family expenses, he also keeps milk cows.  He sold the cow he had previously, to meet the needs of his family.  Now he needs a loan to buy another milk cow.The loan will help him cut expenses for milk and milk products. 

In the future, he hopes to further expand his farm and increase the number of cows he owns.  His goal is to improve the life of his family. 

He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is a 24-year-old, hard-working man, with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For three years, he has been selling beers and sodas and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his child. Like most traders, he has the challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the demand. His dreams are to own a depot and to educate his child to attain a degree, as minimum qualification. 

Jerome intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Vilma, together with her husband, has been in the rice farming business for more than 18 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually, its harvest. 

Vilma dreams of expanding their farm in order to generate the additional income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda is 47 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Blenda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Blenda has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, 26 years old, is married to a technician, and blessed with two children.She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. With this business, she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP a month. 

She would like to get a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, and beverages. 

She's hoping that her store will become more profitable so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old, married man, father of two children. He has been working as a butcher for 17 years. He was only 13 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living and covering their expenses. In 2009, Ali opened his own butchery and he is very proud of himself because of this step forward towards improving his family's living.

Ali is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to increase his business capital and to buy necessary house needs. He will paint his house after the slight damages done from the winter season.

Ali is well-known in his region, with his clean butchery and the good quality of products he sells. He is working hard to update his business and keep up with his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and to buy necessary house needs.

loans.name: Houndoda

texts.fr: Marié à une couturière mr Houndoda âgé de 27ans est tapissier de profession. A la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert son atelier afin de rendre service à ses clients. Aidé par 03 personnes, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des matières premières. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à créer d’autres ateliers et arriver à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 04ans et père d’un enfant d’un an.
texts.en: Married to a clothier, Mr. Houndoda, aged 27, is an upholsterer by trade. At the end of his apprenticeship, he opened his workshop to provide services to his customers. Assisted by three persons, he is requesting an initial loan to purchase some raw materials. The profit derived from the sales will help him to create other workshops and to be able to meet family needs. He has four years of seniority and is the father of a 1-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Limaya

texts.en:
Limaya is 36 years old, married and has four children to feed and send to school. Her husband is a farmer.
